Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower and rosette in added white outline with red centres and linked by white tendrils; exterior: diagonal stroke pattern around rim above maeander band between lines; below, billet pattern between lines; below, trace of object at left break; pendant triangle and part of pendant roundel as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: The interior decoration pattern stands out as being one of the most elaborate for Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p.121-3, fig. 65, p. 257, no. 469, pl. 64)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1545) (phase 2)
